page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {CONSERVATION AREA }- This area lies to the north of the village and is of special architectural or historic interest.As far as TRANENT is concerned NO alterations at all can be done without planning permission. OLD PARISH CHURCH - This is one of the oldest churches in East Lothian dating back to the 12th century.The present church was constructed to a great extent out of the old and built in part on its foundations in 1801.It also records one of the earliest sabbath schools.Entries in the session book show that Mr.Paisley the then schoolmaster held classes as early as 1788.After the battle of Prestonpans in 1745,Colonel Gardiner was taken to the manse where he later died of his wounds.It is reputed that he still haunts the manse.
